edu.wm.cs.cs301.slidingpuzzle

Class PuzzleGameGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • edu.wm.cs.cs301.slidingpuzzle.PuzzleGameGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class PuzzleGameGUI
extends java.awt.Frame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener
    A simple sliding puzzle game implementation. Original source code downloaded from http://freesourcecode.net/javaprojects/72834/Sliding-puzzle-game-in-java#.Vv16t2PGNSU Code has been refactored to work with PuzzleState interface to encapsulate state representation and connection between states.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setupMenuBar

        private void setupMenuBar()
        Fills the menubar with pulldown menus for filehandling, organizing the board, setting visibility of lines and numbers This object serves as the one and only listener for all menu items.

      • resizeWindow

        private void resizeWindow()
        Calculates and sets the overall window size from the size of a single square

      • setDimensions

        private void setDimensions()
        Sets dimensions to default values. Dimensions may change if a picture is loaded from file.

      • cleanUpForTermination

        private void cleanUpForTermination()
        Method encapsulates code to terminate application.

      • runWinningDialog

        private void runWinningDialog()
        Operates a pop up dialog to congratulate the user for solving the game.

      • runDialogForEmpties

        private void runDialogForEmpties()
        Operates a pop up dialog to let the user select the number of empty squares for the game. The board and display are updated accordingly. Changes field emptysquares.

      • runFigureSelectionDialog

        private void runFigureSelectionDialog()
        Operates a pop up dialog to let the user select a file with a jpg figure to display. The board and display are updated accordingly.

      • loadImageFromFile

        private void loadImageFromFile(java.io.File f)
        Loads an image from the given file and prepares a 4x4 board of images. Method also resizes and updates the screen.
        Parameters:
        f - is the file to load the image from

      • setUpImages

        private void setUpImages(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Split image into a 16 square fragments for a 4 x 4 board. If image is rectangular, we select the largest possible square image that is contained in the overall rectangular image.
        Parameters:
        image - whose pieces are used to put on display

      • setImageForValue

        private void setImageForValue(int value,
                              java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        For a tile with the given value, this method stores the corresponding image.
        Parameters:
        value - has a range 1,2,...,15
        image - is the image fragment to store

      • getImageForValue

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImageForValue(int value)
        For a tile with the given value, this method retrieves the corresponding image.
        Parameters:
        value - has a range 1,...,15
        Returns:
        image is the image fragment for the given tile

        Parameters:

        private boolean hasEmptyNeighbor(java.awt.Point p)
        tell if selected position is has an adjacent position that is an empty slot
        Parameters:
        p - carries (x=column,y=row) coordinates
        Returns:
        true if there is a neighboring empty slot, false otherwise

        Parameters:
        p - graphics point selected on window
        Returns:
        point with (column,row) index pair TODO: fix this counterintuitive order

      • isNeighbor

        private boolean isNeighbor(java.awt.Point lastPoint,
                           java.awt.Point currentPoint)
        Check if the given two points are neighbors
        Parameters:
        lastPoint - with row column coordinates
        currentPoint - with row column coordinates
        Returns:
        true if points are neighbors, false otherwise

      • getNumAt

        private int getNumAt(java.awt.Point p)
        Translate row, column coordinates into an index ranging from 0,1,..., dimension^2-1
        Parameters:
        p - with row column coordinates
        Returns:
        index position

      • checkValid

        private boolean checkValid(java.awt.Point p)
        Checks if a given position as pixel coordinates is on the board and not on the frame.
        Parameters:
        p - pixel coordinates of a point
        Returns:
        true if position hits the board, false if it hits the frame

      • setFinalState

        private void setFinalState()
        Initializes or resets the field finalState. Uses field emptysquares to adjust number of empty squares for the final state.

      • initBoard

        private void initBoard()
        Resets game to 4x4 board and a state where squares are ordered. Resets field state, uses field emptysquares to determine number of empty squares.

      • shuffleBoard

        private void shuffleBoard()
        Perform a number of random flips between tiles to start the game. Pathlength is chosen to be 15.

      • moveOnClick

        private boolean moveOnClick(java.awt.Point p)
        Attempts to move the square at the given position.
        Parameters:
        p - encodes current row, column coordinates
        Returns:
        true if movement was possible, false otherwise

      • gameOver

        private boolean gameOver()
        Check termination condition: grid values form an ordered sequence 1,2,... following the reading direction on the board (left to right, top to bottom)
        Returns:
        true if all positions are in order, false otherwise

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method to start the application.
        Parameters:
        args - not used
